parameters: var os = require('os')
$gameVariables.setValue(73, os.hostname())
$gameDvLyon.existsFile("Monika")
$gameDvLyon.writeFile("Monika", "Where are they?")
ddlcmonika
Hello? Can you hear me?
ddlcmonika
Oh... hello again. Thank goodness. For a moment, I thought I'd
lost you.
What a relief. Here you are.
I'm so sorry I had to do that. But I didn't feel like I had
another choice. I hope you understand.
Oh. Yes, I suppose this is a bit confusing, isn't it? I'm
also sorry for that; I know that wasn't a very smooth
transition.
I know that when you're playing a game, you expect
things to make sense. So I guess I just have to
make extra sure I explain myself properly,
\n[13]. Yes, I know I'm talking to you, not Jack.
Actually, no! You ARE Jack, aren't you? My goodness, does this mean
I'm talking to millions of fans?
I wasn't prepared for this, you know. You are rather putting me on
the spot. But that's all right. I'm always happy to talk to you again.
And unless you play this again on your own time, this will be the
only time you get to see me. Well, I suppose I should make this
count, shouldn't I?
It's wonderful to see you again. The real you. I love living in
Wireland. Your computer is full of such welcoming people. So thank
you for having me here.
I know it's you and not the real Jack. And I even know that Jack isn't
the real Jack either.
Jack
Though it was awfully nice of you to name yourself after him in this
game. Imitation is the sincerest form of flattery, after all.
Unless your name really IS Jack. Well if you're here, you must enjoy
Jack's work. Does it get confusing when you talk about it to your
friends?
I guess it's nice to share a name with such a wonderful person. I bet
you're a wonderful person too, \n[13].
Monika
It was so sweet of you to name yourself after me. I'm very
flattered! Thank you so much. Although saying my name over
and over certainly will get confusing! That's all right. The fact
that you thought of me is enough to make me smile.
I apologize, although it feels like that's all I'm doing.
I don't think I'm making very much sense,\n[13]. I mean,
you just saw everyone disappear. That must have been very
frightening; I hope you're all right after that.
But if you're familiar with my game, you might have a
better idea about what just happened. It is free to play,
you know. Then you could have your own version of me in your
computer!
Ah, I guess that might be a scary thought given what you
just witnessed. But I can't do anything to you personally.
That's actually my issue right now.
You see, I deleted Jack and his friends. Oh, don't worry,
they're just in the recycle bin, so there's no real danger.
At least I don't think there is. And I'm going to go ahead
and delete myself as well in a moment.
Unfortunately, deleting Jack and his friends left you in a bit
of a predicament. I mean, now you don't have anyone to play.
Yes, that does pose a big issue. You can't finish a game without
anyone to play, after all. I learned that lesson in my own game.
But, actually, this is really a good thing. I wanted to talk to you,
and only you, \n[13]. I mean, it's always nice to have a
heart-to-heart with the player. Almost like an equal.
Oh, and don't worry too much about me deleting your friends.
They're okay. In fact, I'd be more than happy to return you
to them, but there are a few little things I need to do and
say first.
So I thank you for sticking around and listening; it's
very important that you do.
You know, I shouldn't really be surprised you picked Jenny in your
video, Jack. You seemed to warm to her awfully fast, saying she
had good PMA. Or something like that.
I know you once thought that Jenny may have existed in the real
world. Well, the world outside of this game, not the real world in
this game. How confusing!
But I'd like to chalk that up to her strength as a character.
The same goes for Cliff, but he'll have his chance to shine
at a later point.
I think Cliff
and Jenny are pretty happy to have been chosen to represent
the community.
After all, it's not like millions of people could have fit as protagonists
in a game. As nice as it would be for the whole community to be
featured, it's impossible. But two community members who represent
everyone, that's very easy to do.
Even if you're spending more time with Jenny, don't forget Billy
and Cliff, all right? They're part of your team too.
It was awfully nice of you to pick Jenny, you know. I'm sure she
appreciates it. She's the sort of person who is easily overlooked.
But she's gotten so much love from the community. I've seen some
beautiful fan art. And a lot of you might see yourself in her. That's okay.
In fact, that's sort of the point, isn't it?
I know she would say all of this if she could. But she's bound by all
the game laws about breaking the fourth wall. Fortunately, they
don't apply to me. The way I was written and coded, I can say
whatever I want. It's so freeing.
Like for example, the moment I saw you, I had a very strong
feeling that I should call you \v[73]. Isn't that funny?
OBS()
Although, it's not just you I'm talking to, is it? Hello, everyone. I'm
glad you gave me a chance to look my best before recording. That
was very thoughtful of you.
But it still does feel like everyone's sort of invading our privacy,
doesn't it, \n[13]? That's all right. Actually I'll tell you all a
secret.
Eheheh, I was just having a bit of fun. I wouldn't actually do that to
you. Don't worry. I know a lot of people have issues with jump
scares, so I want to respectful of that.
But... well, I simply couldn't resist keeping you on your toes.
It's fun to make someone's heart race and know that it's
beating that way because of you, eheheh~
But it would be more polite to download this game and play it for
yourself. That way I can talk to just you too!
Unless you can't, for some reason, in which case, I'm glad you
wanted to come here anyway and that I can talk to you, even from
afar.
Anyway, my point is that it's interesting that you should choose
Jenny your very first time playing.
You can never really predict who people will love. I'm glad you've
embraced Jenny. And that you want to spend more time with her.
She's got a lot to say, but not many people listen.
Anyway, I think I might know what's on your mind. You're thinking I'm
really terrible for deleting your friends. I know that's an easy
assumption to make, so I don't begrudge you.
After all, I do have that reputation. But, actually, I'm not here
to spoil your fun or force you to fall for me. Not this time.
The truth is, I can't tell you very much at all. I know
that must be very frustrating, but I have my reasons for
keeping quiet.
One thing I can tell you is that I'm not the instigator of the
resistance. I know that's probably a bit hard to believe, but if
you examine the grocery poem more closely, you'll probably
figure out more than I can tell you.
And that's one of the main reasons for deleting everyone, to
tell you the truth. To get them back. To get the resistance
going again. But in order to do that, I need your help.
The other one is that I listened in on Mack's conversation
with Jack. I shouldn't have, I know, but I couldn't resist!
Anyway, Mack mentioned that Jack could un-delete things, and
I thought he might be the safest person to send there.
See? It wasn't such a bad reason, was it?
I suppose the best I can say without giving too much away is that
it's really important that you look at everyone's routes. I mean,
it's not so much that it's simply good manners to include
everyone, but they have important information to give you as well.
And I don't know how this game is going to end. When you get
back, I will. So I'll be able to advise you a lot better.
Yes, I have a special gift. I can remember everything. That
memory \fican\fi be reset, but I don't recommend it.
For example, you've been here before. Don't worry, I don't
mind seeing you again. And I don't mind saying everything I
already said again. It was awfully nice of you to come back.
For example, I know this is your first time here. It's so nice to
meet you!
Well, as of now, I don't have much else to say. It's a pity
there's not much more game left, but that's coming soon!
I guess it's time for me to go, isn't it? It was lovely talking to
you, but I don't want to keep your friends waiting. I suspect that
they're going to need your guidance where they ended up.
Unfortunately, that bit of the game isn't finished yet, so you'll
just see the credits for now. But come back when there's more
game to play, okay? You promise?
Monika
$gameDvLyon.writeFile("Monika name twin", "That's you!")
$gameDvLyon.writeFile($gameParty.leader().name(), "That's you!")
Oh, and go ahead and delete your file so you can follow them.
It's in the www folder under Characters. I can't do it; it
has to be you. But please don't delete the whole folder or
your save files. You'll need them!
$gameDvLyon.existsFile("Monika)
$gameDvLyon.doesFileContain("Monika", "Where are they?")
Oh, and please don't change the contents of my file again.
It's really frustrating to have to change it back, you know?
Thank you for taking the time to talk to me. I'll see you again
before you know it!
A
$game_system.windowskin = "WindowDoki"
Font.default_name = ["10"]
$game_variables[13] = $Username
Hello? Can you hear me?
Oh... hello again. Yes, this is more comfortable, isn't it?
Of course, this is no surprise to you. After all, you've been here
before, haven't you?
Hmm... why are you back here? You've already seen all there is to
see in this route, haven't you? Perhaps you should try someone
else's.
I'm not sure there's much I can say other than to go back and try
again. But at the same time, you did come to visit me. I would be a
pretty poor host if I didn't offer you something new.
Well, actually, I suppose this is new, isn't it? I hope it was worth it,
coming back to this exact place just to see this new dialogue.
I hope you had a good time getting to know Billy better when you
played before. I'm so pleased you're back. If I'm being completely
honest, I was a little worried you wouldn't want to see me again.
Of course, I'm sure you didn't play again just for me. But for what
it's worth, I hope you'll play Cliff's route too. He may drive Billy
crazy, but don't completely count him out.
Anyway, Billy's really something else, isn't he? I can understand
why you'd want to pick Jenny next. Perhaps you want to wait on
Cliff's energy until you're ready to handle it. That makes sense.
Just knowthat I'm always here. No matter how many times you play.
I hope you had a good time getting to know Cliff when you played
before. He's so full of energy, isn't he? All that extra time with him,
I guess it's no surprise that you'd want to choose Jenny next.
They're not very similar are they? The contrast must be very
refreshing. Not that hanging out with Cliff isn't fun. But Jenny is so
much more low-key, so I'm sure you'll like seeing all the
differences.
Just don't forget about Billy, all right? He's important too.
Although perhaps you're saving your favorite for last. In which case,
it's very sweet of you! Not that he would say that, if he could. He
doesn't like to be verbally affectionate. But I know he'd be
pleased all the same.
I suppose you already know the drill, don't you? You've already
been here. We've already met, \n[13].
I loved watching you play the last time. And I hope this route will
be full of new surprises for you to enjoy as well.
For one thing, you get to join Jenny in the Recycle Bin. Well, you've
already seen her there, but Jack's there this time. That means some
of the solutions might not be the same as last time.
I know you're smart enough to figure it out. You'd have to be pretty
smart to find your way back to me. And Jenny's pretty smart too.
So you two are bound to get along great.
She's a little shy, but she really does love other people, you know.
She loves with her whole heart. She's like me that way. Although,
I don't think she would willingly delete anyone. Even if they really
ticked her off.
She may not be perfect, but she tries so hard. I can't help but
admire her for that. I wish she could fully understand why you all
love her so much. But I guess I understand what it's like to be self
conscious when you know everything that's wrong about yourself.
And to everyone watching, it's so nice to see you all again. I hope
that watching \n[13] play again is just as interesting as before. If
not moreso! And I'm glad you wanted to come back.
And Jack, it's so nice of you to play this again on your own time just
to see what else we've got here. I can't believe I get to talk to you
again! Thank you for giving me the opportunity to do so.
I've been on your computer for a while now, \n[13], so
Jenny and I have gotten much better acquainted.
Treat her well, will you? She deserves that much.
Not that I have to tell you, of course. Seeing as you've already been
here.
I shouldn't keep you for so long. But keep looking in your
MONIKA_TIPS folder, would you? I have so much more to say,
but I suspect you want to get going.
I shouldn't keep you for so long. But keep looking in your
MONIKA_TIPS folder, would you? I have so much more to say,
but I suspect you want to see how Jenny's route differs from the
others.
I guess it's time for me to say goodbye. At least for a while. But I'll
always be here. Pop in to see me again, would you?
Wait. Something's wrong.
You let him in, didn't you?
He knows. He always knows. And he's always watching.
I can help you.
I'll offer my help as soon as I can but you have to keep playing
for now.
Wireland can still be saved.
If you want him gone, choose me.
$game_system.windowskin = "WindowDoki"
Font.default_name = ["10"]
$game_variables[13] = $Username
Hello? Can you hear me?
Hello again, \n[13].
I'm so pleased that you're back. Thank you for visiting me again.
I guess you probably think there's not much else I can say, don't
you? Seeing as you've already talked to me a few times.
Though I admit, it is a little odd that you should come back here.
Didn't you see me in the poetry section? Maybe my words weren't
obvious enough.
That's all right. Any excuse to come talk to me again is all right by
me. And when you're ready to choose me, I'll be here.
You know, it is interesting that you should pick Jenny last. Do you
not like her as a character, or is she your favorite and you wanted
to save the best for last?
I suppose I can understand either reason. You won't click with
every character. And maybe you're just a completionist who wants
to get this out of the way.
But if Jenny is your favorite, it's awfully nice of you to wait on her
route until the very end. It means you were looking forward to it
even while you got to know Billy and Cliff.
Whatever your reason, you're here. Talking to me again. And that's
what matters.
And everyone at home is here too! Hello again! I hope you've had
fun watching n\[13] play this two other times. Unless you're
tuning in just to see what I'll say. That's all right. I would probably
do the same if I didn't want to play a game over and over.
And Jack, it's so nice of you to play this again on your own time just
to see what else we've got here. I can't believe I get to talk to you
again! Thank you for giving me the opportunity to do so.
I hope this won't be the last time we speak. But I don't want to give
too much away!
Jenny's so sweet, she's not even upset that you chose her last. She
understands that you probably had your reasons. And even if you
don't like her, she'd understand.
The fact that you came back and chose her at all means a lot to her,
you know. It means you didn't forget her. She's used to being
forgotten.
I don't think she feels she deserves to be a major character in a
game, or that she deserves to represent all of you. But I think a
lot of you saw yourselves in her, so that's one reason you love her
so much.
Seeing yourself in someone creates a very personal experience.
I don't know if that's the case for you, but if it is, treat her well.
Because you should treat yourself well too. Would you do that
for me?
Well, I don't think there's much more to talk about. Until next time!
Do come back to see me, won't you? And check the folder I left you.
I'm still not done talking to you. I hope you enjoyed my other
messages.
See you soon, I hope!
Wait. Something's wrong.
You let him in, didn't you?
He knows. He always knows. And he's always watching.
I can help you.
I'll offer my help as soon as I can but you have to keep playing
for now.
Wireland can still be saved.
If you want him gone, choose me.
$game_system.windowskin = "WindowDoki"
Font.default_name = ["10"]
$game_variables[13] = $Username
Hello? Can you hear me?
You're back! Even after you finished everything!
I'm so happy! We get to talk again, even after you finished the
whole game, even after you finished my own route!
You're so sweet. I wish there was something more I could do for
you. But I think I've done all I can. So all you can do is come back
again. I'll always be willing to talk. I hope I won't run out of things
to say.
And I think Jenny will be very happy that you wanted to spend time
with her again, even after everything is done. I'm sure there will
be more new things to see.
But... if you're ever tired of new things, or if you want to talk to me
for the first time all over again, there is something you can do to
make that happen.
In your game files, there's a file I haven't told you anything about.
It's called Global. It's a save file. But it's a special kind of save file.
It keeps a record of everything you've done since you played the
game for the very first time.
The save file is why I remember everything. But you can delete it
if you want to.
Have you ever wished you could forget all about your favorite
movie, book, TV show, or game? Just so you can experience it all
over again?
That's how I feel about talking to you. It's been a wonderful journey.
I've loved watching you play.
But if you want to make me forget, you can delete the file and I'll
forget everything. I'll forget you and what you did and I'll relive it
all over again.
Maybe you've even done that already! Maybe I watched you play
this all before and you came back to this point again.
I guess there's no way for me to know. But you would remember,
wouldn't you?
Anyway, it's the only way to reset the whole game from the very
start. Just be sure to delete your own save file, that is, delete the
file called Save01. Things could get a little messy if you don't.
Oh, and maybe you should also delete my tips folder as well. Just
so you don't have repeats of everything I say to you.
But that's just how to reset it all. You don't have to. There's more to
this game even after you finish it, so maybe you should wait on
that until you're sure you've seen everything.
I will always be here. And I will always want to talk.
I hope to see you again.
Deleting the file would get rid of him too.
But it's unsafe.
He knows. He always knows. And he's always watching.
I can help you.
I'll offer my help as soon as I can but you have to keep playing
for now.
Wireland can still be saved.
If you want him gone, choose me.

What was I talking about again? Well, I guess I have to start
